name: pyprland
description: Internal built-in plugin allowing caching states and implementing special commands.

commands.name: compgen
commands.full_description:
<shell> [default|path] Generate shell completions.

Usage:
  pypr compgen <shell>            Output script to stdout
  pypr compgen <shell> default    Install to default user path
  pypr compgen <shell> ~/path     Install to home-relative path
  pypr compgen <shell> /abs/path  Install to absolute path

Examples:
  pypr compgen zsh > ~/.zsh/completions/_pypr
  pypr compgen bash default

commands.name: dumpjson
commands.short_description: Dump the configuration in JSON format (after includes are processed).
commands.full_description: Dump the configuration in JSON format (after includes are processed).

commands.name: help
commands.short_description: Show available commands or detailed help.
commands.full_description:
[command] Show available commands or detailed help.

Usage:
  pypr help           List all commands
  pypr help <command> Show detailed help

commands.name: reload
commands.full_description:
Reload the configuration file.

New plugins will be loaded and configuration options will be updated.
Most plugins will use the new values on the next command invocation.

commands.name: edit
commands.short_description: Open the configuration file in $EDITOR, then reload.
commands.full_description:
Open the configuration file in $EDITOR, then reload.

Opens pyprland.toml in your preferred editor (EDITOR or VISUAL env var,
defaults to vi). After the editor closes, the configuration is reloaded.

commands.name: validate
commands.full_description:
Validate the configuration file.

Checks the configuration file for syntax errors and validates plugin
configurations against their schemas. Does not require the daemon.

config.name: include
config.description: Additional config files or folders to include

config.name: plugins_paths
config.description: Additional paths to search for third-party plugins

config.name: colored_handlers_log
config.description: Enable colored log output for event handlers (debugging)

config.name: variables
config.description: User-defined variables for string substitution (see Variables page)

config.name: desktop
config.description: Override auto-detected desktop environment (e.g., 'hyprland', 'niri'). Empty means auto-detect.
